job_posting.full_description:
Are you interested in reducing barriers to internal trade? Do you have experience working successfully in federal, provincial, and territorial settings to advance Saskatchewan's priorities? Have you worked in a fast paced, dynamic environment?
The
Ministry of Trade and Export Development
has an exciting and challenging opportunity for a diplomatic, creative and detail-oriented individual with excellent interpersonal skills to fill the position of Senior Trade Policy Analyst.
The Opportunity
Within the Ministry’s Strategic Policy and Analysis Branch, the Trade Policy Unit focuses on advancing Saskatchewan’s interests in both internal and international trade policy, including trade agreement negotiation and implementation, market access, and trade disputes.
As part of the Trade Policy Unit, you will be responsible for:
Representing Saskatchewan on Federal-Provincial-Territorial committees and working collaboratively with other jurisdictions to advance Saskatchewan’s trade priorities.
Facilitating collaboration with other ministries and agencies, conducting research, and providing analysis and advice on Saskatchewan’s interests related to trade agreement negotiation and implementation, and other policy matters that impact trade.
Opening markets for Saskatchewan exporters through dispute resolution procedures in international and internal trade agreements.
Advising and collaborating with other ministries and agencies to advance their objectives consistent with Saskatchewan’s trade obligations.
To be successful in this role, you will bring:
Communication skills to explain verbally and in writing complex policy issues clearly and credibly to a variety of audiences.
Interpersonal and negotiation skills to advance government objectives in interprovincial, federal-provincial-territorial and international forums.
Research and strategic thinking skills to analyze issues, identify options, solutions and implications for Saskatchewan and make recommendations.
Knowledge of the Saskatchewan economy, its industrial and resource base, and its trade and investment capabilities and requirements.
Typically, the knowledge and skills for this position will have been acquired through completion of a Master’s level education in an applicable field combined with relevant experience. Professional experience in government (provincial or federal) will be an asset, as will direct trade policy, dispute management and negotiation skills.
This position may be required to travel within and outside of Canada.
T
he Ministry of Trade and Export Development supports a values-based culture that includes respect and integrity, serving citizens, excellence and innovation, and acting as one team. You must be a team player, able to both lead and collaborate, with a reputation for integrity, service excellence and innovation.
What we offer:
Dynamic, challenging work for talented individuals.
A competitive salary.
Comprehensive benefits package including health, dental and pension.
Vacation, Scheduled Days Off (SDO) and other types of leave (maternity/paternity/adoption leave, family/personal leave, sick leave).
Inclusive work environments.
Advancement opportunities.
Flexible work arrangements.
